segments.text: I notice the water is just pouring out of the sink, and the woman doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on that stool, reaching for cookies like he’s done it a hundred times before.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for her share, like this is completely normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so focused on drying that plate, like nothing else exists.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is wobbling, and he’s still stretching for more cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger, and she’s still just drying that same dish.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so calm, but inside, it’s a disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how unaware she is of everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall, and she won’t even notice until it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is almost empty, and she hasn’t done anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever look up from that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR
